excited.description: Sets the spoken text to varying levels of excitement. Valid values are low, medium (default), and high.

emphasis.description: Add or remove emphasis from a word or phrase. Valid values are strong, moderate (default), reduced, none.

date.description: Speak the text as a date. Valid date format values are mdy, dmy, ymd (not universally supported), ydm, md, dm, ym, my, y, m, d.

volume.description: Modify the volume of the speech. Valid volume modifiers are silent, x-soft, soft, medium (default), loud, x-loud. Default to medium if not specified.

disappointed.description: Sets the spoken text to varying levels of disappointment. Valid disappointed modifiers are low, medium (default), high.

time.description: Speak the value as a time. Valid values are hms12, hms24.

lang.description: Sets the language. Words and phrases in other languages usually sound better with the lang tag. Valid values are en-US, en-AU, en-GB, en-IN, de-DE, es-ES, it-IT,j a-JP, fr-FR.

ordinal.description: Speaks a number as an ordinal: first, second, third, etc.

dj.description: Change the voice to a dj voice. Supported on Alexa only.

default voice.description: Sets the spoken text back to the normal voice for the plaform. Useful when switching to different voices.

newscaster.description: Sets the spoken text similar to how a news announcer would speak them.

address.description: Speaks the selected text as a street address.

unit.description: Speaks the value as a unit. Can be a number and unit or just a unit.

sub.description: Substitute one word or phrase with a different word or phrase. Often used to expand/clarify abbreviations.

phone.description: Speak the number/value as a 7-digit or 10-digit telephone number.

interjection.description: Speaks the text in a more expressive voice.

fraction.description: Speaks the value as a fraction.

characters.description: Speaks a number or text as individual characters.

ipa.description: Provides a phonemic/phonetic pronunciation for the contained text using the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA).

pitch.description: Raise or lower the tone (pitch) of the speech. Valid values are x-low, low, medium (default), high, x-high.

rate.description: Modify the rate of the speech. Valid values are x-slow, slow, medium (default), fast, x-fast.

audio.description: Plays short, pre-recorded audio. Value in the tag should be a fully qualified URL to a publically accessible audio file.

whisper.description: Speak text in a whispered voice.

number.description: Speaks a number as a cardinal: one, twenty, twelve thousand three hundred forty five, etc.

break ms.description: A pause in speech. Value is set in milliseconds.

break strength.description: A pause in speech. Valid values are none, x-weak, weak, medium, strong, x-strong

voice.description: Apply voice modifier and use any Alexa voice. Valid values are Ivy,Joanna, Joey, Justin,Kendra, Kimberly, Matthew, Salli, Nicole, Russell, Amy, Brian, Emma, Aditi, Raveena, Hans, Marlene, Vicki, Conchita, Enrique, Carla, Giorgio, Mizuki, Takumi, Celine, Lea, and Mathieu.

voice device.description: Apply voice modifier and switch back to the default device voice

voice en-US.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-US Alexa voices. Valid values are Ivy, Joanna, Joey, Justin, Kendra, Kimberly, Matthew, and Salli.

voice en-UK.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-GB Alexa voices. Valid values are Amy, Brian, and Emma.

voice en-AU.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-AU Alexa voices. Valid values are Nicole and Russell.

voice en-IN.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to en-IN Alexa voices. Valid values are Aditi and Raveena.

voice de-DE.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to de-DE Alexa voices. Valid values are Hans, Marlene, and Vicki.

voice es-ES.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to es-ES Alexa voices. Valid values are Conchita and Enrique.

voice it-IT.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to it-IT Alexa voice. Valid values are Carla and Giorgio.

voice ja-JP.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to ja-JP Alexa voices. Valid values are Mizuki and Takumi.

voice fr-FR.description: Apply voice modifier and limit to fr-FR Alexa voices. Valid values are Celine, Lea, and Mathieu.
